Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the applicant can obtain a judicial stay of removal based on the three-pronged test: serious issue, irreparable harm, and balance of convenience
Crimes.Governing_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (IRPA) s. 48, Federal Court rules (DORS/98-106)
Crimes.Application_Facts: Applicant delayed filing until two days before removal; previous risk claims rejected; cited family separation and unresolved immigration issues
Crimes.Court_Ruling: Applicant does not meet any of the three criteria for a stay
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Delayed application submission with insufficient justification
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Family risks in the U.S., pending immigration applications
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Three-pronged test: serious issue, irreparable harm, balance of convenience
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Timing of application, merit of claims, precedent on irreparable harm
Crimes.Review_Standard: Judicial review based on legal precedents and statutory requirements
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Previous claims of risk were rejected by authorities
Crimes.Evidence_Used: Prior decisions rejecting risk claims, details of family ties and pending applications
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: Claims of family separation and potential harm
Crimes.Relief_Sought: Stay of removal to prevent deportation
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Federal Court rules on stays and IRPA provisions on removal
Crimes.Evidentiary_Deficiency: Failure to demonstrate irreparable harm or serious legal issue
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: Family separation not recognized as irreparable harm under case law
Crimes.Cause_Description: Applicant sought to delay removal citing family risks and ongoing immigration matters
Crimes.Evidence_Handling: Court reviewed prior determinations and current submissions
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Violated: IRPA s. 48 â€“ overstaying and failure to comply with removal
Crimes.Evidence_Issues: Insufficient evidence to establish irreparable harm
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: No serious issue raised, no irreparable harm shown, balance of convenience favors enforcement
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Lack of new or compelling evidence to justify delay

Crimes.Crime_Name: Failure to comply with a removal order under the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Crimes.Dispute_Type: Deportation compliance and stay of removal
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the applicant meets the three criteria for granting a stay of removal
Crimes.Governing_Law: Federal Court precedent and IRPA framework
Crimes.Procedural_Context: Application for interim relief pending further immigration proceedings
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Previous rulings found no risk to life or safety; claims inconsistent with past findings
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Affidavits, prior decisions, family circumstances, immigration history
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Potential harm to family in Colombia and ongoing immigration processes
Crimes.Evaluation_Standard: Three-part test: serious issue, irreparable harm, balance of convenience
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Late application and lack of demonstrated irreparable harm
Crimes.Application_Error: Filed only two days before scheduled removal
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Interim relief standard in immigration context
Crimes.Application_Factor: Timing, credibility, strength of humanitarian claims
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Timeliness and substantive merit of stay request
Crimes.Standard_of_Review: Reasonableness and correctness as applicable to legal and factual issues
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: Failure to meet any prong of the stay test
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Inadequate proof of irreparable harm or serious legal challenge
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness: Opportunity to apply was available but not timely used
Crimes.Credibility_Issues: History of rejected claims undermines current assertions
Crimes.Jurisdictional_Focus: Canadian immigration law and Federal Court jurisdiction
Crimes.Omission_Type: Failure to apply for relief in a timely manner
